author: {'steamid': '76561198096099509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2005, 'playtime_at_review': 2399, 'last_played': 1712186187}
review:
Dope game, I actually like the ending since I thought the explanation made total sense especially if you consider some facts from the second game. 

Some people here are down voting a game that obviously had them hooked until the end, because they didn't like the ending. Bruh, you liked the game stop crying.

I thought the game was way too expensive when it came, now I'm realising that I need something similar and that's hard to find, guess they priced it right.

author: {'steamid': '76561199093874865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3658, 'last_played': 1708460792}
review:
Gioco stupendo, che mi ha incollato allo schermo per una cinquantina d'ore e che inaspettatamente addirittura supera i suoi predecessori, 

PRO:
-I processi: essi sono molto piÃ¹ ragionati rispetto ai primi due giochi, dove talvolta i moventi dei killer venivano un po' campati per aria.
-I personaggi: il cast presenta personaggi interessanti e misteriosi e che subiscono un ottimo sviluppo, facendo evolvere i rapporti interpersonali in modo naturale e godibile.
-L'ambience: il gioco, grazie alla sua musica azzeccata ed atmosfera intrigante, fornisce un perfetto ambiente per far prendere luogo omicidi contorti e misteriosi.
-Le emozioni: grazie a plot twist inaspettati, lore affascinante e tragici omicidi, il giocatore prova costantemente un mix di emozioni diverse, che culminano durante i processi e durante le rivelazioni piÃ¹ scioccanti.
-il finale: personalmente l'ho adorato e sono contento che la mia serie preferita abbia ricevuto una conclusione con la C maiuscola.

CONTRO:
-La longevitÃ : sebbene la storia sia ricca ed invogli il giocatore a scoprire nuovi elementi, sono presenti vari punti morti, nei quali Ã¨ possibile annoiarsi e perdere la voglia di giocare.
-Il mastermind: similmente ai primi due giochi, il mastermind agisce secondo ideali ambigui e piuttosto astratti.
-Il post-game: purtroppo a differenza degli altri giochi non Ã¨ presente un porting di una light novel e le altre modalitÃ  sono molto scarne.

CONCLUSIONI:
Se avete giÃ  giocato gli altri giochi e visto le varie stagioni dell'anime, questo gioco Ã¨ assolutamente un must play. Sebbene non aggiunga di fatto nulla all'arco narrativo della Hope's Peak Academy, esso Ã¨ estremamente godibile e rappresenta un'ottima conclusione ad una serie cosÃ¬ affascinante. 
Voto finale: 9,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198050514110', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 31, 'playtime_at_review': 2785, 'last_played': 1712002564}

author: {'steamid': '76561199143011111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1325, 'playtime_at_review': 2254, 'last_played': 1711867876}
review:
Really enjoyed replaying this, definitely my favourite entry in the series - though I know the ending was somewhat divisive!

I know it says 'unsupported' for the Deck currently, but I played through in its entirety on Steam Deck (didn't 100% it, but I finished the game ay least). Beyond it crashing out if you try to skip cutscenes (including intro and credits), there were a few minor glitches. Otherwise a very smooth gaming experience! Appreciate future updates may make it less playable so don't trust me without checking - but noting that I took the risk and it worked for me!

author: {'steamid': '76561198818910700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 845, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1712454783}
review:
WHAT THE F*CK OF THIS SH*T! 
almost finished the 1st trial and I understand why the rating is lower than the previous two. Why do you need to do this plot twist? I'm  sad and angry. Pls don't play this as there is no HE.

author: {'steamid': '76561199151977333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2386, 'last_played': 1641114633}
review:
LOVE THE DANGANRONPA SERIES!!! But that ending literally ruined it for me. I couldn't even finish the last few minutes of the game because of it.

I spend hours, days, weeks, and months loving this series. I only ever watched the gameplay of the first and second game, so I got really excited when my parents allowed me to play the third game. But I'm really disappointed of this game. I couldn't find myself to get attached to any of the characters aside from kaede and kokichi, so it already was a pretty meh game to me. 

I still managed to find love for the overall game, but the ending of "it's all a lie" was what really killed me, driving me to drop it. It made me feel as though all my time enjoying the game was really wasted, as if it didn't matter. I understand it was a bunch of pixels either way, but I want the characters to feel alive within THEIR world, but you're telling me that they're not? Such a huge turn off.

author: {'steamid': '76561199237945255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 854, 'playtime_at_review': 3207, 'last_played': 1712089793}
review: First Danganronpa game I owned, and it's fantastic. Although the class trails and investigations sometimes confuse my dumbass, The likeable characters make up for it. People complain about the ending, but honestly, you just learn to accept it. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995001589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 428, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1711452048}
review:
The ending will make you regret spending time on that game...
I'm really not a fan of the "oh it's a lie in a lie in a lie in a lie" because it makes in the end the whole plot/interest you had for said plot meaningless.

Imagine if Agatha Christie wrote one of her famous mystery/crime novels, carefully laying pieces and hints all along to, in the end, tell you straight "ah lol there's no plot, it's a lie, or maybe I'm lying now saying it's a lie so you can't know what's true or not and what you were interested in, that is, the plot, doesn't exist hehe I'm so smart".

author: {'steamid': '76561197973580399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1849, 'last_played': 1711262292}
review:
I don't think I've ever been so accurately and thoroughly called out by a video game before.  Bravo, Danganronpa V3, bravo.

(Also, the presentation is great, the characters are fun, the music is awesome, and the trial minigames have never been so well executed, along with some genuinely clever murders.  You really should play DR1 and 2 first, though.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994925219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 51, 'playtime_at_review': 2907, 'last_played': 1711400801}
review:
i finally got around to playing and finishing this game today, and i think it's probably my favorite of the mainline Danganronpa games. I think it has the best minigames and trial mechanics and the individual murders are challenging and fun to solve, but i didn't find them too overly convoluted.
At any rate, while I think I may like it the best, it is definitely best played AFTER playing the other two main games, and they are great as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198117354920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 135, 'playtime_at_review': 3558, 'last_played': 1711319650}
review:
(no spoilers)
Summary: Get it when its on sale, its not worth full price as its very buggy but still a great experience.
Note- Launch with control layout first so you can have PC controls displayed instead of default Xbox display.

The game was released after Danganronpa 1, 2, Despair sisters, and all the anime and movies but you dont need any of them to understand the plot. Still recommend playing first 2 games though as there are MAJOR spoilers for the plot of the first two games.

Review:
I'm having a hard time recommending it because the Class trial control scheme is swapped from 1 and 2, By default shows you non-pc Inputs, is horribly optimized causing it to lag and be Unresponsive during the most trivial of dialogue, and the "Shooter" vs "Danganronpa" control option is broken and doesnt change anything, instead of swapping the silencer and truth bullet controls back to traditional controls like its suppose to, it does literally nothing. During class trials inputs can even get eaten horrendously because of lag creating an extremely frustrating experience.

BUT,

The story is very well made and the game is still a lot of fun. I 100% cant look past how poorly put together it is but there is definetly a great game behind that mess. Also the poorly optimized issue seems to be relatively new since I played the game near release without steam years ago on a crappy pc and did not have the latency and lag issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066545264', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6599, 'last_played': 1709182826}
review: I loved this game. I understand why some people hate the ending but I think that it was quite risky for them to opt for a narrative like that yet they still decided to do it despite what the general fanbase might think. Out of the three main Danganronpa games, this is the one with the best written and most interesting characters and most enjoyable mechanics. I can't say the same about the extra modes though, they are very boring and nobody asked for them, yet they are necessary to get the 100%, zzzz. Anyways, good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313933769', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1710291565}
review: I really want to like this game, but even though I haven't gotten very far into it yet I have racked up more negative opinions about it than positive ones. If you're playing with a keyboard and mouse, half the time it won't even register your inputs. It also has a habit of randomly switching itself out of fullscreen and back to windowed mode, and the only way to fix this is to relaunch the game as, to my knowledge, there is no in-game setting to set it back to fullscreen. It took me about 4-5 hrs to get through the prologue and even longer to get to any part of the game that felt like it had any real narrative value or fun gameplay. Don't get me wrong, I like visual novel style games, but even so I still want to feel like the game I'm playing is actually a game and not just a vaguely interactive movie. I also think its very distasteful to have characters that are supposed to be high schoolers appear on screen in nothing but their underwear and having characters that are minors making what feels like near constant sexual jokes, or having those jokes made towards them. It just feels gross :/ I don't know if that is something that this franchise has done in all of their previous games as this is the first one I have purchased, and had I known that this would be such a big aspect of the game I never would have bought it. I absolutely love the concept of this game and it had been on my wishlist for awhile, but I don't know that I'll be able to bring myself to finish it. With all the bugs on PC it almost feels like a chore to play. I'm glad I bought this game on sale because in no way is it worth $40 and honestly even the sale price has left me feeling a little bit ripped off.

author: {'steamid': '76561199014507678', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2806, 'last_played': 1608925682}
review:
Danganronpa is such a complicated series to talk about because each game succeeds in incredibly different ways from one another, while slightly taking away from other parts. Case and point, I personally think this is the weakest installment in the main trilogy, but oh my FUCKING god those cases are good. If you liked the first two games there's a lot to get out of this one, just know that everything from its predecessors is cranked up to its logical extreme here (for better or for worse).

Also, about that ending: give it a chance, if it upsets you then think about what that tells you about the nature of endings like that, and how (and this is my personal opinion) it subverts the trope's usual pitfalls

author: {'steamid': '76561198299735724', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 2128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1486, 'last_played': 1710069778}

author: {'steamid': '76561199093224022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2294, 'last_played': 1709455127}
review:
so im like sitting here because i really spent 38 hours playing this game after not touching it since 2022. i think that this installment of the franchise, though it has like hella flaws, is pretty great and doesn't deserve the hate it gets. The cast of characters are just as interesting and fun as the previous games and the trials/executions rarely disappointed so i was pleased fr. this game also gave me rantaro amami and thats more than i could ask for. the only thing i have a sliver of a problem with is the ending...honestly i knew what they were trying to do but i feel like it probably couldve been done a little better, and thats basically my only issue with it. I think the ending gets more hate than it should, it was still a bomb game i feel..... its bold and unique and kodaka was definitely not afraid to get creative with it which i thoroughly enjoyed. unrelated but i also lowkey hate the way shuichi sounds, like okay bro we get it... what are you trying to achieve. it runs super well on the steamdeck btw, idk why steam tells you its not good on the deck because take it from me and my hours that it works great.
oh i also hated the ending of the first chapter like ugh. maybe not a fault of the developers or the story itself i just personally did not like the outcome.... i wont get into it bc spoilers but just know. its ugh. okay thx bye

author: {'steamid': '76561198064705993', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 2089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2089, 'last_played': 1710284083}
review:
Still early on but I don't like this version of the game as It doesn't properly display the PC controls what i mean is that there will be times during class trial where you have to mash "B" B =D so that's annoying. for future players: 
W - corresponds to Y.
A - corresponds to X.
S - corresponds to A.
D - corresponds to B.

Then there are the Cubs, they kill the tension for me, the scene is serious its building up the tension and these stupid cubs come and make stupid jokes annoying me, Really I could tolerate Monosuba but more of him is just not needed for me, I just finished the first Trial and it completely threw me for a loop, did not expect how it would turn out and Its beautiful. I loved the Danganronpa series so looking forward to seeing what else is happening.


Update 

After playing this game I don't know why its priced as it is, compared to the first 2 games? 

I have a mixed view of this game, I didn't enjoy the experience but there were Moments I liked, I love about the Danganrompa series is the mystery and finding comfort and intrigue with the characters you're stuck with some are complex and have ulterior motives while others are just so boring and repetitive: Tenko Chabashira repeating "degenerate males" quickly got old REAL FAST.  

One Thing I absolutely could of done without would be the Monosuba bears, they ranged from obnoxious to more obnoxious and killed it for me. so Gimmicky

I thought that the game play didn't really need all the game mode, like Psyche Taxi, you're just collecting orbs to create questions and driving to answers its not that great and for me killed the pace as I'm getting into it. 

Ending was not what I expected, but I didn't really care at that point just wanted to finish it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198877606012', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 2289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2289, 'last_played': 1708974556}
review:
Adieu AcadÃ©mie du Pic de l'Espoir, bonjour AcadÃ©mie des Prodiges condamnÃ©s. Nous attaquons dÃ¨s Ã  prÃ©sent un nouvel arc avec ce nouvel opus, qui va nous promettre encore un tas de rebondissement dans cette nouvelle Tuerie se dÃ©roulant Ã  nouveau dans une Ã©cole.

Si vous jouez Ã  cet opus, c'est que vous avez sÃ»rement dÃ©jÃ  jouÃ© aux 2 opus prÃ©cÃ©dents, vous savez dÃ©jÃ  si le principe vous plait. Nouveaux personnages, nouveaux meurtre Ã  rÃ©soudre lors de procÃ¨s de classe, la formule de son cÃ´tÃ© ne change pas.

Nous retrouvons Monokuma cette fois-ci accompagnÃ©s de Monokumers, qui sont ces enfants.

Dans l'ensemble, le jeu tient les mÃªmes promesses que les prÃ©cÃ©dents. Ce qui est incroyable, c'est qu'aprÃ¨s 3 opus, ils sont quand mÃªme capable de se renouveler autant dans l'histoire que dans les principes.

Durant les procÃ¨s de classe, vous aurez maintenant la possibilitÃ© de mentir pour faire avancer les dÃ©bats. J'avais vraiment peur au dÃ©but de ce principe mais il cela s'est finalement rÃ©vÃ©lÃ© plus simple que je ne le pensais Ã  utiliser et j'ai mÃªme finis par l'apprÃ©cier.

Un autre nouveau type fais son apparition en procÃ¨s : le clash d'opinion. Quand le groupe n'arrive pas Ã  se mettre d'accord et s'oppose en 2 Ã©quipes, le mode s'enclenche avec pour principe de trouver la bonne phrase Ã  rÃ©futer selon les mots clÃ©s de l'opposant. Et franchement, j'ai Ã©normÃ©ment apprÃ©ciÃ© ce mini-jeu, j'Ã©tais limite dÃ©Ã§u qu'il n'y ait pas pas beaucoup.

En point positif du jeu, nous avons la musique et les dÃ©cors, qui reprennent bien l'idÃ©e des opus prÃ©cÃ©dents. L'histoire arrive Ã  nous faire tenir jusqu'au bout, bien qu'il faut lui laisser le temps de se dÃ©velopper en dÃ©but de jeu.

L'idÃ©e de rajouter les Monokumers n'est pas mauvaise bien que je trouve que cela Ã©clipse un peu trop Monokuma. Quand on se souvient de la relation de Monokuma/Monomi dans l'opus prÃ©cÃ©dent, avoir notre ours prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© en retrait est un peu dommage.

Au dÃ©but, je trouvais nÃ©anmoins qu'il lui manquait un charme sans vraiment savoir quoi, mais avec cette fin, je peux affirmer que le jeu est vraiment Ã  la hauteur des prÃ©cÃ©dents.

On abandonne ce cÃ´tÃ© Espoir affrontant le DÃ©sespoir pour en attaquer un autre, plutÃ´t basÃ© sur le Mensonge et la VÃ©ritÃ© (avec le personnage de Kokichi Ã”ma qui ne fait que Ã§a, ainsi que la possibilitÃ© de mentir durant les procÃ¨s pour avancer).

Certains trouvent la fin dÃ©cevante, au contraire je trouve que c'est une excellente conclusion Ã  ce que cette histoire avait Ã  nous offrir, mais je vous laisserai la dÃ©couvrir plus en dÃ©tail.

Au final, Danganronpa V3 arrive Ã  Ã©galer voire surpasser Ã  certains moment ces grands frÃ¨re, et en plus, il y a une traduction franÃ§aise ! (Bien que celle-ci soit approximative avec des fautes nous faisant un peu sortir du jeu).

3 excellents opus, c'est un sans faute pour moi, je vous dit bravo les dÃ©veloppeurs ! 

16/20

review:
Le jeu est excellent et bien Ã©crit comme ses prÃ©dÃ©cesseurs. Je le trouve mÃªme plus fort Ã©motionnellement et il nous met mal dÃ¨s le premier procÃ¨s de classe.

Le gros point faible cependant : la traduction FR du jeu. C'est problÃ©matique qu'elle ne soit pas presque parfaite alors que c'est un jeu oÃ¹ CHAQUE dÃ©tail Ã  son importance. On regrette fortement la team Mirai qui a fait du boulot de bien meilleure qualitÃ© sur les deux jeux prÃ©cÃ©dents alors qu'elle n'est mÃªme pas payÃ©. C'est un petit point qui me met un peu en colÃ¨re contre la team officielle qui a traduit le jeu, mais je ne vais pas en vouloir aux dÃ©veloppeurs d'avoir enfin pensÃ© Ã  nous mettre Danganronpa V3 en franÃ§ais, bien au contraire !

author: {'steamid': '76561198337607363', 'num_games_owned': 1504, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 2141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2141, 'last_played': 1665956599}
review: People shit on this a lot and I think it's wholly undeserved. This pops up in my head right after SDR2 when I think about Danganronpa and how it ruined my life. I had some of the most fun with V3, I mean part of that is the actual worse quality of some writing than THH or SDR2, but it's just an overall enjoyable time and I personally Love the ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383170701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3607, 'last_played': 1704581998}
review: Danganronpa V3 is a game that will make you feel feelings you did not know you had, as the character and story progression and development are unmatched. It goes from just another high school game to one of the best murder mysteries you will ever experience, as they take no time to introduce you to the horrors of the world around you. From the beginning of the game, they draw you in by introducing all of these lovable and unique characters that you can relate to in some shape or form. You will develop feelings for these characters, as they give you hope, but they destroy it just as fast as they give it to you, making it an emotional roller coaster experience. Danganronpa is a game that will change your view of the world once you're done with it and will leave a permanent mark on your life as that is how impactful this game is. However, despite its successes, the game is not without its faults, as sometimes it loses focus on whom a character was meant to be or what the overall meaning of the story or sacrifice was meant to be. Because of this characters you once loved will become your most hated ones, and you will curse at the devs for making it so, but that just goes to show how much they drew you in. To feel genuine hatred or love for a character is not something that comes easy, but Danganronpa V3 seems to do it effortlessly, as each character connects with the player. Adding on to its effect on the player, the story will make you feel as if the world is going to end if you do not see the end of a chapter as they throw interesting twists in unexpected places. In short, this game is not for the faint of heart. However, I can say with confidence that anyone can enjoy this game, flaws and all because you will find yourself sinking hundreds of hours into this game just to see the characters you love once more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198930512213', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2638, 'last_played': 1703354366}
review:
While it is not my favorite in the series, it still had amazing cases (esp the first chapter) and a really wacky cast this time. 

The Monokubs weren't needed in my opinion, they were annoying at times but other than that, I loved being back in a school setting, loved the cases, and I loved the new mini games, they added a fresh feel to the class trial. [spoiler] I especially liked the "Lie" bullet, it was such a great twist that worked well. [/spoiler]

Yeah, the ending is unique, I think everyone has a different opinion on that but it is very..... danganronpa-y to say the least so just don't take things so seriously and I think it's enjoyable that way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997036304', 'num_games_owned': 3192, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 11380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11380, 'last_played': 1656123079}
review:
This is the last one of the series that I've made a review for as I've spent far too damn time on that stupid digging game! I'm the Goddamn Gaming Archaeologist, I should have been able to finish this game in one single go!

Anyway, my frustrations with a single mini-game aside, I have to say that this is the weakest of all the games so far, imo. Beyond certain story-reasons that would go into spoiler territory, there's a few choices in this game that I felt were annoying.

One of the most annoying bits they added to the court-room scenes is the whole lying to uncover the truth mechanic. It can also be used to skip through parts of discussion and get closer to finishing that section.

As typical the Ultimates are all quite interesting and have their own quirky personalities as before and as a fun call back to the other main games, there's quite a big interesting twist at the beginning that certainly creates a lot of surprises and like the previous games I often never saw the deaths or the ending coming, but in the case of this game, I feel that the ending came off as a little insulting and don't really see it as part of the series personally.

Many of the mini-games are a lot of fun and even the one I was complaining about, it fun but attempting to get the max score is next-to-impossible! Especially as the courtroom version you can smash up the small individual rocks where as the arcade version you can't and may even stop you from getting that final score.

It's still fun and I always like seeing more Monokuma and what kind of chaos that annoying bear can cook up as he claims the lives of my favourite characters! Though many in this I didn't feel that strongly for unlike the past two games where nearly ever death and betrayal hit me so hard.

Never give up hope!

author: {'steamid': '76561198138049493', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 3180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3180, 'last_played': 1708316505}
review:
Spoilers for ending, read this is your cautious about playing this game as the ending will most likely change your opinion on this franchise entierly.

Lets put into perspective how the ending for this game plays out:
Imagine that you have just finished watching DragonBall, DragonBall Z and are up to the final moments in Dragon ball Super. Now at this point, you have spent a good while watching this show and have enjoyed the last 3 series a lot and are excited to watch the climax of Goku vs Jiren.

Goku and Jiren have been fighting for some while and the fight is reaching its end. Now, imagine if, Jiren turns around to Goku and says "Goku, your actually in DragonBall Super and are being animated by toei animation and are being watched by millions of people right now." That would be pretty odd, but imagine if he then said, "all of the enemies you have fought over the years are actually scripted pieces of fiction that dont exist in the real world, and you yourself have been given a plotline to follow." 

That would crush and invalidate everything that has happened in the show so far, from the very start.

That is how the ending for this game played out, and its so shit holy fuck how do you make an ending this bad

author: {'steamid': '76561198390831470', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2697, 'last_played': 1708202089}
review: Danganronpa V3 is a fitting end to the whole killing game that Danganronpa 1 and 2 played around with. V3 feels like an incredible jump in both quality and style from Danganronpa 2. The design of the HUD and the 3D text in the class trials make this feel like the finest entry in the Danganronpa series. The story is also incredible, especially when it comes to the various plot points and class trials that happen. The first case especially is something special. V3 usually takes around ~45 hours to complete fully, but even then, there's still post-game content, making this game something you can pick up and still find enjoyment in after completion of the main story. Then again, Danganronpa S exists too, but I digress. Danganronpa V3, while being the final game of the Danganronpa franchise, serves to end the whole series on an interesting note, one I've never seen a series do before. I highly recommend Danganronpa V3, but if you want to enjoy the series in full, start with Danganronpa 1. I'm glad I got to experience something like this, and I do wish they made more, but I understand why they don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031174508', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 2385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2385, 'last_played': 1707576260}
review:
DGV3:KH makes one ask the important questions like:

What the fuck is the age legal age of consent in Japan? [spoiler] (It's 16 which is higher than I was expecting, frankly) [/spoiler]
Why did that girl have an orgasm during a trial debate?
Are Danganronpa fans really so under-developed that they get offended by the ending? [spoiler] (Yes) [/spoiler]

Fun game.  It kind of went through the motions for the most part, which is fair, there isn't a whole lot more I reckon they could do with this format after 2 games.  I had a sneaking suspicion how the ending was gonna play out and I wasn't wrong.  I was cackling with laughter all the way through.  Amazing.

It doesn't do much more than what 1 and 2 already did beyond just telling a somewhat more batshit insane story, but it was great.  I enjoyed it.

idk about the side stuff.  I never really bother with it.

Wasn't as fond of the soundtrack in this compared to 1/2.

A couple of the characters were just really obnoxiously gross.  Was glad to see those ones knocked off.  Others were fine/cool.

It ran great on steamdeck.  Capped at 40fps for some extra battery life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016164777', 'num_games_owned': 389, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 2513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2488, 'last_played': 1706991302}
review:
When talking about this game with people, I've heard people say it's not as good as the original entries and I've heard other people say it's the best game in the series. Now that I've finished this game, I understand why there is this divide in opinion and I understand both sides. 

On the surface level, it's the same Danganronpa that you see with 1 and 2, but when you actually dive into the game, it's differences become much more apparent. Whilst 1 and 2 had their differences in how the trials worked, they are much more comparable to each other than the changes V3 made. I think it's better to let these differences catch you off-guard so I won't go into too much detail but to give a non-specific example (although I will still mark it as a spoiler in case you really want it to be complete surprise), [spoiler]you usually will have to lie and spread misinformation at some point in the trials in order to reach the truth.[/spoiler] This is just one example of how the trials are different, and it's not the only thing that's different in this game. Without revealing too much, the story at first feels familiar, but you slowly begin to realize that things are not as they seem. The ending especially is not something you would expect from Danganronpa or many other games in general. This game also has a much more polished feel compared to the other games, though that's most likely both from the advancements in tech and Spike Chunsoft themselves being a bigger company. There are more examples but to list them all out would just make this review even longer than it needs to be, but just know this game is different in a lot of ways.

Personally, the one thing I always loved about Danganronpa was how unique of a video game it was, and therefore I've always liked it when the game changes things up. Because of that, I feel that Danganronpa V3 is a very unique and enjoyable take on Danganronpa as a whole. There are some reviewers that will tell you the game is only good up to Chapter 4 and after that it sucks because they don't like the ending, but honestly I feel like if the ending were something else, I would probably give this game a lower score.

Overall, an amazingly unique game from a franchise known for its amazingly unique games. 10/10

(P.S. Clair de Lune was an insanely based song choice for the scenes it is in.)

Jokes aside, the game is good till chapter 4. Not so much after that. If you really loved 1 and 2, you might be better off leaving this one alone though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064464406', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1757, 'last_played': 1706826403}
review:
Intentionally writing a shit ending as a form of meta-commentary doesn't make what you wrote any less shit.

Danganronpa 3 is a noticeable step down from the previous two games in the series, pretty much because of the ending. I won't go into any details to avoid spoilers for the rest of the game (which is fine, and on par with the rest of the series), but the hope you get from the main body of the game will be undone from the despair you get from the ending. 

Also the writers seem to have forgotten that dirty jokes work best when used sparingly, something they clearly knew when writing the first two games. At points the dialogue sounds like it was written by a bunch of ten year-olds who have just discovered urban dictionary.

author: {'steamid': '76561199218042715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2350, 'last_played': 1669310378}
review: Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony isn't quite as good as Danganronpa 2, but it's still a very solid murder-mystery game. The ending will be controversial, and I do see some inconsistencies and issues with it, but overall I think it manages to keep the bonkers scale that Danganronpa stories operate on. Kaede & Shuichi and Kaito & Maki make very cute couples.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082351406', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1709090981}
review:
Don't play it if you don't own a controller. I don't know how they managed to fuck up a Visual Novel port, but the game controls horribly on keyboard and mouse. Not only does the game not give you any kbm prompts, the controls are also extremely unresponsive and render certain minigames extremely difficult or downright impossible

Other than that, hey it's danganronpa if you got to the third game you already know if you're gonna enjoy this brand of weird or not

author: {'steamid': '76561199182838892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2588, 'last_played': 1706675549}
review:
The ending to this game is controversial, to say the least. Personally, I thought the ending was good. I don't think it was perfect by any means and there were certain reveals in it that I was a little mixed about, but overall I had no quarrels with the ending. I understand peoples issues with it, and I think most are valid, but despite that, I still enjoyed it [spoiler](maybe thatâ€™s because, the way I see it, the ending encompasses Danganronpa. A cruel reality and a true sense of despair as we learn that all that weâ€™ve been through in the other games never happened, and that all we thought we knew was false. That despair is the epitome of Dangonronpa, and this time, weâ€™re the victim. Also for it to be revealed in such a brazen and startling way, that catches even the player off gaurd as itâ€™s something they never expected, that shock is the feeling of Danganronpa, anyways, sorta rambled a bit)[/spoiler].  However, do not discount the game just because of the higher amount of negative backlash it has received. Even if the ending isn't too your liking, the rest of the game is still just as impeccable as any other Danganronpa game and the cast is just as likeable. Every character this story threw at me was amazing and I loved each one, every case the game created was gripping and engaging, and the game play is easily the best out of any game. Personally, I love this game just as much as the other two, each game in the series has its own merits and flaws, so its impossible for me to rank them. 

TLDR: Despite what you may have heard, still give this game a try. I doubt you'll regret it. Also it has gambling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164356963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 4606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4606, 'last_played': 1632887940}
review: Note to beware, it'll end on a note that leaves you still grasping for the truth! But as a mystery series, perhaps that's for the best? In many ways, it's the perfect ending! It's definitely a game that will leave you with a strong opinion, one way or another. If you've read the other games, don't be afraid to try this one as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198383466474', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 4397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4397, 'last_played': 1676074251}
review: These games are soooo much fun. It's actually one of my favorites. Between this series and persona. I've bought all the manga, watched all the anime, even go as junko for anime conventions. These games are amazing and I'm really hoping they continue,  maybe a full reboot or prequels. I don't care but we need more. Start a kickstarter if needed. Three is not enough. The story is amazing, game play is fun, mysterious are always fun to play along with. Im even itching to play them all again but 9f course it's not as much fun the second time around, you know everything by then. You must buy all three. 1 and 3 are tied for my favorites but it's all very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312265423', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4022, 'last_played': 1705542397}
review: De lejos es el peor port de la saga, Â¿PorquÃ© tendrÃ­a que googlear los controles de un juego por el que paguÃ©? ah si, porque no pudieron simplemente poner la equivalencia de control en teclado (en los juegos anteriores si, no me explico porque en este no), la historia y los personajes fueron los mÃ¡s aburridos de la franquicia, uno que otro es rescatable, pero ajÃ¡, le doy crÃ­tica positiva por amor a la saga y porque se puso bueno despuÃ©s de 40hrs de juego xd, entendible si alguien lo dropeÃ³ antes, cuando te revelan pues que tÃ©cnicamente este juego no es canon, llamemosle asÃ­, porque no aporta nada a la historia que llevamos viendo, que creo que era lo que los fans queriamos, que siguieran construyendo el tan buen universo que habian planteado en las precuelas, el spin off y en los animes, sin embargo debo admitir que si fue un muy buen plot twist y el mensaje que intentaron dar, wow, totalmente de acuerdo con el mensaje que no hay que subestimar a la ficciÃ³n, muy bien implementado, no pagarÃ­a ni de pedo por su precio original xd, lo comprÃ© solo porque estaba en descuento, el soundtrack como siempre god, y las nuevas mecÃ¡nicas tambiÃ©n uwu  y los class trials ufff de verdad buenisimos, pero Â¿Â¡porquÃ© quitarÃ­an las mascotas en los monopads!? :/ amÃ© la filosofia de que tanto puede ayudarnos la ficciÃ³n en los problemas de la vida real, es un buen juego de danganronpa y punto, pero favor continuen la historia, gracias.

author: {'steamid': '76561199112863260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7283, 'last_played': 1710008184}
review: In my personal experience as a Danganronpa fan since 2019, this game has always been my favorite. The franchise was at it's peak in 2020. I would definitely recommend others to play this as well. (If you look at my profile and see that I have no achievements whatsoever, I swear I've played this game multiple times just on different devices. I AM NOT A PHONY.) The only problem about this game is that the ending is kind of terrible, but you'll get over it. Many trials will (or might?) make you cry. If you don't wanna get hooked on a character and see them die, I would never play this game, or any Danganronpa game to be exact. Still, if you do and your favorite ends up surviving, then, congrats..

author: {'steamid': '76561198128105089', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3042, 'last_played': 1705209010}
review:
Casi nunca escribo reseÃ±as salvo para los juegos que de verdad siento que lo requieren.

La mayor parte del juego me encantÃ³, todo el desarrollo, los juicios, la mÃºsica, los personajes, etc.
Le doy recomendar porque el 99% del juego me parece excelente, pero el juicio final es... raro. Es inesperado y la forma en que se lleva el tema del mundo de Danganronpa es... raro. No me terminÃ³ de convencer la Ãºltima parte del juego.

Entiendo la idea de cÃ³mo quisieron abordar lo del mundo del juego y el tema de los personajes y sus trasfondos pero no sÃ©, no me encantÃ³. Sin embargo, muy probablemente yo no lo habrÃ­a hecho mejor.

AÃºn asÃ­ es un gran juego que da cierre a esta gran saga que es Danganronpa, sin duda debe ser jugado (recomiendo ampliamente jugar Trigger Happy Havoc y Goodbye Despair antes de este, ya que hay algunas cosas que se entienden mejor si lo has jugado.)

9/10 por ese final abrupto y totalmente inesperado, le dieron la vuelta en un segundo a las 40 horas de desarrollo anteriores.

Himiko best girl.

review:

O [b] visual [/b] desse jogo tÃ¡ simplesmente maravilhoso, foi uma grande evoluÃ§Ã£o comparando com os jogos anteriores. A [b] gameplay [/b] tambÃ©m teve uma melhora absurda na minha opiniÃ£o. author: {'steamid': '76561198035007897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 7610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7610, 'last_played': 1688903433}
review:
A japanese visual novel as anime as humanly possible, topped with ridiculous characters, ridiculous behavior and several murder mysteries. Be aware that in order to appreciate this title you need to be deep down the anime rabbithole and/or enjoy the western style meme potential that arises from japanese approaches of entertainment. Or if you are a weirdo like me, you use this game as a language learning resource. Be careful if you are the latter, as the characters routinely speak in heavy accent and in a quite rude manner, although out of all the DR games this one is the best for that purpose.

Story wise this is a fair contender of the Dangan Ronpa series, although I would concede to find Dangan Ronpa 2 stronger on the character side. Nevertheless, the happenings though sometimes predictable have a knack for deceiving the audience on some plot points. A caveat here is a truly hit or miss ending that may leave you in complete apathy, tears, laughter or anything in between.

Gameplay wise the series returns with a stupendous amount of text containing overexplanation, cheesy content that can only be described as animu and overreactions left right and center. As is the case with many japanese visual novels, you wade through a great amount of dialogue to get to the actual murder happenings and the following trials. Said trials go through the murder mysteries in great, dare I say overbearing detail. You will be surprised to find that a failure to account for a piece of gum under the counter is enough for incrimination as the actual murderer here. Not as much however as you will be about the small number of completely unnecessary downright ridiculous minigame "enhancements" the 500 IQ devs of the Dangan Ronpa series have come up after their murder of the question -> answer multiple choice format. Said minigames can instill feelings in any order of confusion, disbelief, amusement and annoyance.

Lastly to be said, a great amount of the tension in the game is less about the atmosphere, which is decent, and more about the uncertainty whether or not *your* favorite tipsy goofball is next on the chopping block. A good emphasis is on the likability / dislikability of characters and the player wanting them to survive and/or kick the bucket already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118053906', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 6227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6227, 'last_played': 1704798916}
review:
I love the ideas the game challenges... Hope and Despair, Truth and Lies, Reality and Fiction... and how, in many ways, they are not just a yin and yang that must balance each other, or require each other to exist, but that they are all a false dichotomy. Beautiful ideas.

I liked the cast, but I also feel like it's the weakest cast. Though, in my opinion, some of the most fun cases.

That doesn't automatically mean I like what they did with the ending though. I like a lot of things about it, and I like the message it conveys and the takeaway, but it's easily the weakest narratively, and I also hate how I feel criticized for even feeling this way about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259733144', 'num_games_owned': 1481, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3449, 'last_played': 1704517696}
review:
I just played all of the Danganronpa games currently and i'd say that....i wish they had made DR4,I really love the characters in here Way more than other Games(Kaito,Ryoma,Himiko,Maki Even Kokichi is Well writen character),They added Extra mechanics and gamemodes compare to 1-2 aswell(Casino,Hotel,Board game,Same Post game content) There are way more stuff to say the least,The gameplay is SOOOO good compare to 1 and 2,i wish another game had similar gameplay like V3 did,The problem is that as everyone complains it....the ending,i also thought the ending was a disappointment but i understand why they had to do it,Both The company and Danganronpa fans can be obnoxious most of the time,This is basically a tombstone of why you should Let people cook the game properly instead of pestering it,Its kinda impossible to get another game since the creators of danganronpa left spike chunsoft and Cooperated with Zero escape creators,I still think this game is amazing gameplay and story wise(until the end),i wish they had made more but i respect what they had done,If i would Rank all of the series,it would just go out like....

Story Wise:3(without ending)>2>Udg>1>3(With ending)

Gameplay wise:3>2>1>Udg

Soundtrack wise:3>2>1>Udg

Overall score would be 7.5/10
If the ending was good enough,i'd make it 9/10 and probably be in top 10 of my favourites

Even though i hated the ending at the start,it felt better later on even though it gave me a bitter taste of wanting more danganronpa games like V3(Gameplay Wise)

review: Honestly, just play up to the end of Chapter 5 and don't complete chapter 6. it just isn't worth it. I didn't find myself getting as attached to the characters as I did in Danganronpa 2, but I highly enjoyed all of the trials (minus chapter 6, of course). The 5th trial in particular was my favorite of the entire series I think. But please, if you don't want to ruin the entire series for yourself, skip chapter 6, you'll enjoy all of Danganronpa more if you do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092607213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2180, 'last_played': 1704174697}
review:
The ending of this game ruined the entire franchise for me. I would recommend reading a spoiler for yourself and see if it's worth it for you or not. They hint at the ending enough and I was praying that I would be wrong because [spoiler]meta[/spoiler] is definitely hard to pull off. I also didn't want to end my love for Danganronpa with a [spoiler]meta[/spoiler] ending when there was so much lore to explore. For example, let's say you watched The Walkind Dead. Imagine the whole [spoiler]Rick Grimes was dreaming it the whole time was actually real[/spoiler]. It'd feel like such a cop out after 11 seasons. They did it after a season or two? Sure, I'll take it. It's a similar thing with Danganronpa. I've invested around 100 hours, and now you're telling me this is how the series wraps up? 

The main problem is that the ending is extremely long winded and cheapens out on the experience. There were so many better directions the story could've gone and it just felt like my emotional and time investment never paid off. If you look at the game as V3 alone, it's not too bad, but if you account the world building since the first game and wanted to experience more of it, anybody would be pretty disappointed. It literally felt like the devs said, screw it, we can't think of anything better so we're going to go with this halfway through plotting the story. The game probably would've been better off if it was a lot shorter. I think that's what it comes down to. If you don't really care for world building, you'll probably be okay with the ending. If you're playing V3 to see what the entire series leads up to, you're going to be sorely disappointed. 

TLDR; The ending was not handled well. It felt very lazy and cheap because of the mediocrity and lack of novelty. Once you've read enough of [spoiler]meta-fiction[/spoiler], these endings really become repetitive and everything you've invested null and pointless. Acceptable if you look at it as a standalone game. 

EDIT: I did some further reading and read that the devs had to deal with a lot of toxic fans, which explains the whole f you vibe I got from the ending. I still stand by my review, but I feel for the devs and understand why V3 turned out the way it did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044478473', 'num_games_owned': 725, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1522, 'last_played': 1703675967}
review: I think this is the weakest Danganronpa game in the series. The game does enhance the minigames we're already familiar with in the previous iterations, but it's a visual novel. You aren't playing for the gameplay. The first and last act in the game were by far the most interesting in the game, but I was not fully invested in the characters nor their motivations in acts 2-5. I don't want to spoil the game in the review, but I didn't like how they developed the antagonist. I did like the main trio and their dynamic. I also liked Kokichi, but the rest of the cast were pretty bland. Still a decent entry in the series and a fun VN, so I'd still recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847008065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1707160159}
review:
Great game, insanely good gameplay, insanely bad control.

Danganronpa V3 is the 4th game of Danganrona series (Danganronpa 1: Trigger Happy Havoc, Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair, Danganronpa: Ultimate Despair Girl, and lastly, Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony).

Why the game has "V3"? Because there is an anime called: Danganronpa 3: The endof Hope's Peak Academy. 

Should you play the game right after finished Danganronpa 2? NO. Play Dananronpa: Ultimate Despair Girls, then read a bunch of light novel, manga, anime. The mandatory one is Danganronpa/Zero + Danganronpa 3 anime.

Good things about this game:
- Amazing gameplay, introduce a lot of cool minigame concept.
- PEAK CHARACTER DESIGN as well as UI and overally better looking than the rest of Danganronpa series.
- Great Voice Actor, make sense because all of them already voice acted in previous games.
- Good music.

Bad things:
- UNRESPONSIVE KEYBOARD AND MOUSE CONTROL. Make sure to play in PS4 or Nintendo Switch for maximum compatibility, playing in windows is a gamble between using controller and be fine or absolutely destroyed by pressing D 5 times and the game won't even response once, then press A one time and it move twice with keyboard and mouse. Also bad keybinds as well.

- BAD PLOT, BAD STORY, in general, typical plot twist disaster. Not spoil anything, but I bet you heard at least 9/10 players said bad things about the ending and the result of TRIAL 1 (never check spoiler for Trial 1, don't make mistake like me. If you feels temped, feel free to skip all Danganronpa/Zero, Danganronpa anime and jump right into the game with no pause. You must run through Trial 1 spoiler free, then you can get the fck out of the game if you hate the result of that trial, I can guarantee, me and the whole community hates it.)

- Extra things about how the game released in 2017 and now it's 2023 (near 2024) and they DIDN'T FIX THE COMPATIBILITY ISSUE WITH WINDOWS. Who are you? Cyberpunk 2077? At least they FIXED THE BUG!!@@

author: {'steamid': '76561198024465696', 'num_games_owned': 664, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2968, 'last_played': 1703671689}
review: Longer case trials, new (and old) characters, mechanics and bonus game modes, V3 takes a bit from all the previous installments and wraps it up nicely with a bow tie. I found the characters not as likable as in the first two games but overall it was a worthwhile experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190067074', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1689563178}
review:
Once again, trapped and locked inside of a school. Only this time you're stuck with a karate master with a misandry complex, a gay adventurer, a robot, a horny inventor who needs to watch her fucking language, a novice magician, a cosplay chick, a lying grape flavored goblin, and a goth possibly gay detective.

BUT WAIT THERE'S MORE! Now there's five talking bears! Five times the fun!

Oh, and lots of people die.

10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010966696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2638, 'last_played': 1581746927}
review: It's pretty much a requirement to have played DR1 and DR2 before playing this, so by this point you know what you are getting yourself into. All I can add is that I do think this is the game with the best story and protagonist in the series. It does have problems, but I thoroughly enjoyed it.
